The population was 490 at the [[United States Census, 2000|2000 census]]. ==Geography== Amber is located at {{coord|35|9|35|N|97|52|44|W|type:city}} (35.159613, -97.878766){{GR|1}}. According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the town has a total area of {{convert|4.0|sqmi|km2}}, all of it land. The Post Office was established in 1903. ==Demographics== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 490 people, 160 households, and 132 families residing in the town. The [[population density]] was 124.2 people per square mile (47.9/km²). There were 176 housing units at an average density of 44.6 per square mile (17.2/km²). The racial makeup of the town was 89.18% [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 0.20% [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 4.90% [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 1.22% [[Pacific Islander (U.S. Census)|Pacific Islander]], 0.20% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 4.29% from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 2.04% of the population. There were 160 households out of which 47.5% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 74.4% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 7.5% had a female householder with no husband present, and 16.9% were non-families. 15.6% of all households were made up of individuals and 5.0% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 3.06 and the average family size was 3.34. In the town the population was spread out with 34.9% under the age of 18, 6.9% from 18 to 24, 29.8% from 25 to 44, 20.0% from 45 to 64, and 8.4% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 29 years. For every 100 females there were 96.8 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 95.7 males. The median income for a household in the town was $32,083, and the median income for a family was $34,688. Males had a median income of $24,531 versus $20,375 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the town was $12,012. About 9.7% of families and 10.8% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 9.2% of those under age 18 and 22.2% of those age 65 or over. Amber is also home of Amber-Pocasset Jr. Sr. High School, home of the Panthers. ==References== <references /> ==External links== * [http://digital.library.okstate.edu/encyclopedia/entries/A/AM001.html Encyclopedia of Oklahoma History and Culture - Amber] {{Grady County, Oklahoma}} [[Category:Populated places in Grady County, Oklahoma]] [[Category:Towns in Oklahoma]]
